testsuite.name: au.edu.uq.smartass.question.ArithmeticSeqSumNTermsExceedXTest
testsuite.system-out: Let $2,6,10$ be the first three terms of a finite arithmetic sequence. How many terms are needed for the sum to first exceed $1000$? Let's solve this as an equation then round appropriately. \begin{align*} S_n&=\dfrac{n}{2}(2a+(n-1)d),\text{ where }d=6-2=4\text{ and }a=2.\\ \text{Therefore }1000&=\dfrac{n}{2}(2\cdot2+(n-1)\cdot4)\\ 1000&=\dfrac{n}{2}(4+4n-4)\\ 2000&=n(4n+0)\\ 0&=4n^2+0n-2000\\ n&\approx22.36 \end{align*} So $23$ terms are required. $23$
